task.name: Provide and document medical care for MEDEVAC.
task.author: D
task.objective: The Field Medic is to provide and document medical assistance to a casualty. If required, a MEDEVAC should be requested.

task_environment.name: Alpha (Mgmt View)
task_environment.dependencies: This task is dependent on systems securely working, e.g. radio, handset. There is a dependence on Alpha and Charlie to provide management and operation of other MEDEVAC aspects for the continuum of care.
task_environment.narrative: A casualty is attended to by a Field Medic who assesses the injury. Medical treatment is applied. If a MEDEVAC is required, the 9-Line Request information is gathered before calling for MEDEVAC. The MEDEVAC is request over the radio to the TOC. The FMC-TCCC is completed prior to the arrival of the MEDEAVC detailing patient injuries and care given. One copy is retained and the original is sent along the patient journey with the Air Medic. Patient information including FMC-TCCC details are added to the MC4 Mobile handset then uploaded to the TMDS data repository.
task_environment.consequences: This task is required to provide initial care for a casualty. If this is not conducted, there is a risk to life. If care is not documented and accessible for continuing care, this may affect or delay patient care.
task_environment.benefits: This initiates the continuum of care, where medical issues are reduced by medics and hospital care.

obstacle.name: Un-Secure Field Medic Radio Transmission FM-TOC

obstacle_environment.name: Alpha (Mgmt View)
obstacle_environment.definition: The 9-Line request is made over the radio without ensuring the transmission is secure and encrypted.

probability.rationale: Given the environment, it is possible this may occur at times. If the communication was unsecured, someone could listen-in and gain patient and location information placing the unit and MEDEVAC at risk of an attack.

obstacle_environment.name: Bravo (Ops View)
obstacle_environment.definition: The 9-Line request is made over the radio without ensuring the transmission is secure and encrypted.

probability.rationale: Given the environment, it is possible this may occur at times. If the communication was unsecured, someone could listen-in and gain patient and location information placing the unit and MEDEVAC at risk of an attack.

obstacle_environment.name: All Systems (Overview)
obstacle_environment.definition: The 9-Line request is made over the radio without ensuring the transmission is secure and encrypted.

probability.rationale: Given the environment, it is possible this may occur at times. If the communication was unsecured, someone could listen-in and gain patient and location information placing the unit and MEDEVAC at risk of an attack.

obstacle_environment.name: Charlie (Ops View)
obstacle_environment.definition: In a combat situation, the information may fly away or dropped out of the helicopter in a conflict zone.

probability.rationale: As the FMC-TCCC is lost, we consider the data as being lost due to its inaccessibility, and therefore concerns availability. However, this scenario now has the potential for confidentiality and integrity to be at risk. Given the environment, it is possible this may occur occasionally.

obstacle_environment.name: Charlie (Ops View)
obstacle_environment.definition: As the FMC-TCCC is often placed on the patient, blood may leak onto the FMC-TCCC.

probability.rationale: Given the environment, it is possible this may occur occasionally. A physical copy of the FMC-TCCC card information is not available meaning no record of initial care given is documented. This may slow down on-going care, or could mean medication is given where not required. This may be mitigated if the FMC-TCCC is uploaded by the field medic to the TDMS accessed by FST and Air Medics.

obstacle_environment.name: All Systems (Overview)
obstacle_environment.definition: As the FMC-TCCC is often placed on the patient, blood may leak onto the FMC-TCCC.

This may slow down on-going care, or could mean medication is given where not required. This may be mitigated if the FMC-TCCC is uploaded by the field medic to the TDMS accessed by FST and Air Medics.

obstacle_environment.name: Charlie (Ops View)
obstacle_environment.definition: The FST Technician discloses patient information with unauthorised personnel accidentally during a course of discussion.

probability.rationale: Given the environment, it is possible this may occur at times. Details may be overheard disclosing patient information impacting confidentiality of patient and may affect the required level of care, causing distress and distraction.

obstacle.name: Un-Secure Field Medic Radio Transmission TOC-AM

obstacle_environment.name: Alpha (Mgmt View)
obstacle_environment.definition: Details of the 9-Line request to MEDEVAC is made over the radio without ensuring the transmission is secure and encrypted.

probability.rationale: Given the environment, it is possible this may occur at times. If the communication was unsecured, someone could listen-in and gain patient and location information placing the unit and MEDEVAC at risk of an attack.

obstacle_environment.name: Charlie (Ops View)
obstacle_environment.definition: Details of the 9-Line request to MEDEVAC is made over the radio without ensuring the transmission is secure and encrypted.

probability.rationale: Given the environment, it is possible this may occur at times. If the communication was unsecured, someone could listen-in and gain patient and location information placing the unit and MEDEVAC at risk of an attack.

obstacle_environment.name: All Systems (Overview)
obstacle_environment.definition: Details of the 9-Line request to MEDEVAC is made over the radio without ensuring the transmission is secure and encrypted.

probability.rationale: Given the environment, it is possible this may occur at times. If the communication was unsecured, someone could listen-in and gain patient and location information placing the unit and MEDEVAC at risk of an attack.

obstacle_environment.name: Charlie (Ops View)
obstacle_environment.definition: The Air Medic may have also been injured en-route with patient care, meaning they have been disabled from communicating verbal information, retaining the patient information.

probability.rationale: Given the environment, it is possible this may occur at times. Verbal information may not be available for patient and medic patient information, meaning data is not accessible, or input into field laptops delaying or affecting the required level of care.

obstacle_environment.name: All Systems (Overview)
obstacle_environment.definition: The Air Medic may have also been injured en-route with patient care, meaning they have been disabled from communicating verbal information, retaining the patient information.

probability.rationale: Given the environment, it is possible this may occur at times. Verbal information may not be available for patient and medic patient information, meaning data is not accessible, or input into field laptops delaying or affecting the required level of care.

obstacle_environment.name: Alpha (Mgmt View)
obstacle_environment.definition: Power is unavailable due to an attack on the base. In a combat situation, due to other constraints power supply may not always be possible when required. Sometimes this may be due to shelling from a mortar attack.

probability.rationale: Given the environment, it is possible this may occur occasionally. Without the ability to receive, process and further transmit this request, no MEDEVAC request will be made and the patient could die.

usecase.name: C-F1-2 Transfer Patient and Info from AM to FST
usecase.author: D
usecase.description: The Field Medic creates a FMC-TCCC card detailing care given, passing it on to the Air Medic and retains a copy. MEDEVAC arrives at FST passing on the information.

usecase_environment.postconditions: Process and store

usecase_environment.name: All Systems (Overview)
usecase_environment.preconditions: A patient requires medical care. A FMC-TCCC card is created. MEDEVAC is called for. MEDEVAC arrives at FST.

step.description: Document and pass on patient and info

usecase_environment.postconditions: Process and store.

usecase_environment.postconditions: Treatment continues for the patient with document care whilst TOC contacts PECC and Air MEDEVAC.
